Name: Das Ägypten der Pharaonen
Description: The players run through a labyrinth full of obstacles to find the treasure chamber of Tutanchamun.

Name: The Great Northern Trading Company, 1670
Description:
Great Northwest Territories is an exciting, commodity driven worker placement game set in the Hudson Bay area in 1670s.  The player's small trading companies will compete to build up the settlement, explore the wilderness, trade manufactured resources from Europe amongst themselves and the indigenous tribes in the region, to gain furs and other locally produced commodities, such as maple syrup and artwork.  There is a market where the price of goods rises and falls according to supply and demand.  Players will have to fulfil contracts with the ships at port and the indigenous tribes.  Doing so to gains a player victory points, as do building new key buildings in the community.  The player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Das römische Reich
Description: The players train hard to become better and better and finally fight in the collosseum.

Name: Fopp' den Frosch
Description: Chaos at the frog pond! One child plays the frog with a huge frog eye mask. The other children hide the flies.

Name: A Touch of Evil: Hero Upgrades Game Supplement
Description:
As the Heroes close in on the Villain that has been terrorizing Shadowbrook, they will need to keep their wits about them and use every strength they can muster to overcome the evil that stalks them. There can be no turning back now, and no holding back in their fight for survival!

This 24 card Game Supplement for A Touch of Evil adds a new dimension to the game and an entirely new mechanic in the form of Hero Upgrade cards. Now Heroes can use the Investigation and Event cards they've found on their hunt for the creature to 'Level Up', unlocking stat bonuses and a new Ability. Each of the 24 cards in this set is unique and applies to a specific Hero, covering all of the Heroes released to date from the base game, Something Wicked, The Coast, Hero Pack 1 and Hero Pack 2.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Airplane Game
Description: This is simple game from the 1960s with the goal of racing around the race course. Players must spin the game's spinner and advance their plane based on the number of spaces scored. If they land on a space already occupied by another player's plane, this causes an "air interference" and the player must land his plane for repairs (i.e. they would get sent back to the starting space, but does not lose any already completed laps). First one to complete 5 laps around the course is the winner! Plus, the game board, spinner, and box have that great 1960's art style.

Name: Sevilla Futbol Club
Description:
A Trivia game about the centenary of the Spanish football team Sevilla FC.
Contains a die, pawns, a board and cards with about 1000 questions and answers in 5 categories.

Name: Le Jeu du Sud Manche
Description:
Le Jeu du Sud Manche

is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers. 
Nearly 550 written and visual questions including "junior" questions dealing with subjects as varied as History or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the southern Manche region, country of the Bay of Mont-Saint-Michel, including the towns of Avranches, Granville, Mortain, Pontorson, Villedieu-les-Poêles, Saint-Hilaire-du-Harcouët.

Name: Dicey Curves: Road Rally
Description:
Team racing on the open road!

Dicey Curves: Road Rally, a racing game for 1 to 4 players, is an updated take on the Dicey Curves series.

Use Fuel and Control tokens to move your 2-car racing team down the randomized, curving rally course, and then roll dice to gain more tokens for your next turn.

Score more points than your opponents by getting your cars through the checkpoints before theirs.

—description from the designer

Name: ワカサギ (Ice Fishing Hokkaido)
Description:
A card game for family fishing fun.

Go ice fishing in Hokkaido and discover the best fishing spots, water depths, and bait options! Draw different event cards and see who can catch the most Wakasagi (Japanese pond smelt)!

In this game, one "boss" player draws three fishing information cards without showing the other players. These other "fishermen" players, in turn, try to predict the fishing information by placing pieces of ice on the cards. Depending on how many of their predictions are correct, the boss will call out the sound "Kon!". If the boss calls out more than two "Kon"s, it means a fish has been hooked. However, if the fisherman fails to call out "Hit!" before the boss finishes saying a total of 10 "Kon"s, the fish will get away!

In the case that the fishermen calls out "Hit" in time, he or she will get to take a card from the Wakasagi fish pile. If not, the Boss will receive a card instead.

After either player draws a fish card, he or she will also need to draw an event card. An event card can be either positive or negative (for example, get an extra 2 fish...or a fox steals one of your wakasagi cards). There's even an event card that forces a player to caw like a crow for his or her next turn.

Name: Vampiros en el Puerto: el juego de tablero
Description:
Adaptación del comic del mismo nombre, mezcla elementos de RPG con turn based movement.
Maneja una de cuatro facciones, con hasta cuatro personajes cada una.

Based in the comic book of the same name, this game is heavy influenced by RPG and tactical games. Each player has to control one of four factions fighting for the control of a city, using between one and four characters. 
Each turn the player has to roll a die and move his characters accordingly and try to accomplish one of two things to win: rescue a character from the Prision in the center of the board, or be the last faction alive, eliminating all others by combat.

Name: Myth: Dawn of Heroes
Description:
Myth: Dawn of Heroes is a cooperative tabletop game for 2 to 5 players. Each player takes on the role of a hero and must work together to overcome the Darkness. Using a deck of cards unique to each hero, players explore the realm, battle evil monsters, manage critical tasks, and avoid dangerous traps in order to complete quests and acquire powerful new items and abilities.

Players' avatars are called Heroes. Myth Heroes are clothed in immense power, able to reave all but the mightiest foes. However, this power must be balanced lest the Darkness take too much notice. Players must weigh their actions against the Threat each will bring, with the consequences of awakening more evil and bringing doom on the party's endeavors. And be careful they must, as the Darkness is formidable and eager to snatch glory from the valiant.

Heroes are controlled through an intuitive Hero Deck (videos for each Hero can be found in the Game Play Videos section below). Each deck plays uniquely and allows players more freedom of action and the ability to truly impact the Story each and every Act. Yet, cooperation is the key to victory and bloody fortune. Players must communicate, interact, and assist each other or surely the Darkness will cover all.

Myth is a fully cooperative game. There is no player controlling the Darkness. The Darkness is governed by a set of rules unique to each Boss Deck and is activated through Hero actions. If the Heroes get overzealous, then the Darkness pushes back by activating Lairs, spawning Captains, and punishing the Heroes with devious Events. If the Heroes take a more subtle approach, then the Darkness reacts by reducing the potential for treasure and rewards. Without the treasures and equipment to upgrade, the Heroes will find each Act more difficult and eventually fail. The dynamic nature of the Darkness really lends a more fluid feel to the Story. Players aren't being driven by properties out of their control, nor are they being shepherded by a person whose skill has a direct impact on the enjoyment of the game.

Myth is a fun fantasy romp where players feel truly heroic. In the playing of the game, the players are creating their own mythos. These stories are the ones carried away from the table, becoming myths themselves. And these are the myths, with friends and family, that we carry with us; telling and retelling our endeavors at the mead benches, earning treasured smiles and laughter.

—description from the designer

Name: Waroong Wars (Second Edition): Character Expansion 1
Description:
This promo consists of 4 cards addition to the main game:


     Mas Shala 


Character card
Start the game with a "Secret Spice" card. "Secret Spice" card count as "Go Boy!" card. You can have 2 "Go Boy!" card max.


     Mrs Van Meijden


Character Card
Before shopping phase, choose 1 displayed menu card by placing "Madam Choice" card above it. When you cook it this round, take an extra point token.


     2 Pempek


Menu Card (6 VP)
Need 3 "Unique" and 1 "Spice" cards.

Name: Alfa i omega
Description:
Promotional item added to MÓ§ller's products. This game is a clone of Spot it! but with only 31 cards and 6 symbols on each card. Each card features eight different symbols, with the symbols varying in size from one card to the next. Any two cards have exactly one symbol in common. The rulebook explains only one micro game in which players are dealt all cards and 1 card is left in the middle. Then all players try to get rid of their cards by matching symbols with their card and the current card in the middle. The winner is the player that gets rid of their cards first.

—user summary

Name: Bill & Ted's Riff in Time: Rufus' Remix
Description: Bill & Ted's Riff in Time: Rufus' Remix allows you to add a fifth player to the game, namely Rufus. In addition to the Rufus miniatures and player cards, this expansion has plastic miniatures for each of the "Personages of Historical Significance", which you can use in place of the cardboard standees in the base game.

Name: Bill & Ted's Excellent Historical Trivia Travel Game
Description: To get historical figures into your phone booth, players must answer trivia questions in six topics: Geography, US History, World History, Women in History, Music History, and Heinous History.  The board folds out from the box and features magnetic playing pieces.  The first player to collect all six historical characters and return to San Dimas High School for your oral report wins.

Name: White Steeds and Seax
Description:
An adaption of the Dark Age Infantry Slog rules adding cavalry, White Steeds and Seax is a simple set of miniatures wargaming rules for Dark Age / Arthurian Britain.

The combat system, inherited from DAIS, is unusual; in each combat, a single die is rolled to see which stat (aggression, formation, or strength) is "trumps" for that round; the side with the lower relevant stat suffers damage to its stats. The table rolled on to determine trumps changes from turn to turn, with agression being most important at the beginning of a combat, gradually losing importance to first formation and then strength.

Name: Reavers of Midgard: Tablet of Mischief Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the 2020 GameBoyGeek Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

Tablet of Mischief:

Any: Discard this artifact to change the faces of up to 2 if your dice to sides of your choice.

Name: Reavers of Midgard: Tablet of Wrath Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the 2020 GameBoyGeek Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

Tablet of Wrath:

Any: Discard this artifact to reduce the difficulty of any combat check by 2.

Name: Vauban's Wars: Wargame Rules for Siege Warfare
Description:
Vauban's Wars allows you to become one of the great captains of siege warfare: Vauban, Coehorn, Marlborough, or Prince Eugene of Savoy to name a few. The rules are designed to produce a fun and playable siege in an evening of gaming. The rules cover from 1672 to 1815 with these specific wars in mind:

Wars of the Louis XIV (1688-1697)

War of the Austrian Succession (1740-1748)

Seven Years War (1756-1763)

Turkish Wars vs Russians and Austrians (1710-1812)

Wars of the French Revolution (1792-1802)

Napoleonic Wars (1803-1815)

Vauban's Wars allows the flexibility of using the player's favorite tactical rules for large sorties and assaults.

A turn is roughly 3-4 days, and the rules cover powder supply, critical damage, unique events, disease, weather, food supply, security, trench raids (minor sorties), coups de main, popular support, sapping, mining, countermining, espionage, etc.

1 x Spiral bound rule book – 97 pages (full color)

1 x Turn & Weather Sheet (hard card stock and full color)

2 x Quick Reference Sheets (hard card stock and Black and White)

1 x Powder Expenditure Sheet (hard card stock and full color)

6 x Sequence Deck Card Sheets that you can cut out and sleeve. (hard card stock and full color)
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession
Series: Piquet – Master Rules for Wargaming

Name: SUPER©©STACCS
Description:
SUPER©©STACCS is a creative matching and stacking card game played in three dimensions... it expands the world of flat cards into a multi-dimensional playing experience, creating a visually beautiful and imaginative game. While the rules are super simple, no two games look alike.

Each hexagonal card is designed to look like a cube with three visible surfaces to make matches on. Players are dealt 7 cards each and take turns matching and placing cards onto the STACC until their hands are empty.

Certain cards have attack and special effects that add to the strategy and unpredictability of the game. Use court cards to force other players to take on more cards, or play a wild card to reboot and reorient the game in a different direction.

The first player to get rid of all their cards wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: YIAY: The Board Game
Description:
YIAY (Yesterday I Asked You) is the game that settles the debate on who's the funniest in your friend group! Play with a group of 3-8 people and compete to get the most laughs!

Draw from 8 different categories and a total of 400 cards to decide the next rule. Each category places a different rule on how you have to answer the prompt. It could make you draw, write riddles, rhyme, or even think of slogans! The possibilities are endless when you’re making up your own answers!

There are two ways to play. Players take turns being the Host. The Host rolls the die and selects a card from the matching category. Everyone then has 60 seconds to write or draw their answer! Everyone else in the group answers based on what they think the Host will like best. The Host collects and reveals everyone's answers, then chooses their favorite!

Or, everyone submits answers, including the Host. The group uses the voting cards (that's the cards with the numbers) to pick their favorite answer. The pressure is then on for the Host to prove they're the funniest!

If you win the round, you keep the prompt card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!

-description from publisher

Name: Shadow Oracle
Description:
Aside from being an esoteric guide, Shadow Oracle is a fully playable solitaire card game that involves building card sequences as a means to win; not unlike many games that use traditional playing cards. Card suits are referred to as the voices, which encompass five categories (evolution, hedonism, reason, science, and shadow). These categories help distinguish associated card text.

A session of Shadow Oracle consists of two segments, the game segment and the esoteric segment. The game segment is necessary for performing the esoteric segment. However, the esoteric segment is not necessary for a full game experience (the game can be played strictly on its own).

The game involves building three columns of cards before a game-ending trigger occurs. If the game segment is completed successfully, a follow-up procedure narrows down the cards used in the esoteric segment. The final step involves reading and interpreting the card text. The card text draws on the wisdom of non-hallowed disciplines to provide insight for your decision-making conundrum.

—description from the designer

Name: Oak Warriors
Description:
Oak Warriors 

     These rules enable fast play games set in the Age of Sail. 
     Optional rules are included to cover early steam ships. 
     These rules can be used with any models. 
     The required templates are available as a separate free download. 
     The rules provide an engaging and interactive game with the correct period feel. 
     The system enables players to interrupt their opponent's actions so both players are fully engaged for the whole turn.


For a game of a few squadrons a typical dining room table will be sufficient (roughly 5ft x 3ft). For bigger fleet games, a table of 6ft x 4ft is recommended. 
Standard D6 dice are used and a ruler with inches is required. 
You will also need models and terrain to represent the scenario you wish to play.

Movement is managed through a system of signals passed at two distinct levels within the game. The top level is the Fleet Commander's. Below that is the level for Squadron Commanders. Ships are allocated several signals; these can be influenced by higher level commands.

Name: Devolution: The Game
Description:
Inspired by the Max Brooks novel, Devolution.

You are a resident of Greenloop: a small, high-tech eco-community nestled in the Cascade Range. Since the Mount Rainier eruption, you have been cut off from the outside world, trapped in the wilderness with beasts of terrifying strength and ferocity.

CAN YOU SURVIVE THE SASQUATCH ATTACK?

Your objective is to survive the longest while exploring for resources. But the threat of a Sasquatch attack looms in the trees...

A survival game for two to four players. Combine two decks to play with up to eight people.

-- Description from the publisher.

Gameplay: players start with an alarm card (that they can use once to escape a Sasquatch), and two other cards in-hand. The cards are resources that you can use to fend off a Sasquatch attack.

On your turn, you draw a card. Then you have the option to: draw a second card, trade one of the cards in your hand with one of the cards in the discard pile, or end your turn. However, if during your turn you drew a Sasquatch card or two, now you have to deal with it! Hopefully you have the resources you need in hand in order to either flee from or kill the Sasquatch(es).

If you kill a Sasquatch (by discarding javelin cards), you keep the Sasquatch card near you as your score and you get to take any item from the discard pile. If you flee from the Sasquatch (by dropping rations, sounding your alarm, or using torch cards) then the Sasquatch card(s) get  shuffled back into the draw pile.

If you cannot flee from or kill the Sasquatch, then you have been killed and you are out of the game. The last player remaining in the game is the winner.

Name: Only the Strong Survive
Description:
Only the Strong Survive is a game of Dinosaur vs. Dinosaur combat!  
You lead either a single dinosaur or small herd of them in the battle for survival!  This is a scale and model agnostic system that works with any size dinosaur models or toys you own.

Each dinosaur has a pool of Instinct Dice that it allocates to different actions as you play.  
The core mechanic is an opposed dice roll with non-replenishing pools.  
Battle is swift, mobile and full of decisions.  
Fluid game mechanics keep all players in the game as play moves quickly between players. 
The simple (but not easy) game mechanics work great with new gamers or seasoned tabletop pros.

Join the battle for dinosaur survival today!  Only the Strong Survive!

—description from the publisher

Name: Aethermon
Description:
Humanity was already on the brink when The Darkness fell, the light of man all but extinguished. Then the Aethermon appeared - creatures from the AetherRealm, a world already lost to The Darkness.

The Aethermon would make their final stand in defense of humanity. The spirit of the Aethermon remained unbroken, but ultimately their numbers were too few.

Sparked by the valor of the Aethermon, it was a child who rose up first. Standing beside her new allies this child became the first AetherRen.

United the AetherRen and the Aethermon forced The Darkness back into the night as it vowed to one day return.

For generations Aethermon and AetherRen would train, preparing for the day The Darkness would return. But over time The Darkness was forgotten, and the training of Aethermon became sport.

In Aethermon, 2-8 players take the role of young AetherRen competing to claim the Junior Aethermon Championship.

Each player bonds with an Aethermon with their own elemental affinity (Moonlit, Sunstruck, Sky, Earth, Fire, Water, Nature and Thunder) granting them unique abilities and element specific combat moves.

Players explore the world of Aethermon by playing Energy Cards (movement cards) to move around the board. Landing on special locations will trigger story driven events via decksploration mechanics. Landing on mundane squares will trigger battles or encounters.

Battles are resolved by Battle Card mechanics. Success in battle will earn the player XG (experience-gold) a unified currency that can be exchanged for items, increases in stats or new Battle Cards (moves).

As players complete quests and continue on their journey to become the Junior Aethermon Champion they will accrue fans - the player with the most fans at the end of Chapter 1 is the winner of Chapter 1.

In Chapter 2 players must put aside old rivalries to face a greater threat. Victory can only be achieved by working together, recruiting new allies and ultimately pushing back The Darkness one more time.

—description from the designer

Name: Dig Down Dwarf (Second Edition): Gems of Norcia!
Description:
Gems of Norcia is an optional expansion for Dig Down Dwarf. It adds a catch-up mechanic to the base game.

You gain these gems on your turn if you happen to come up empty on your dice rolls. Some of the gems are more rare than others and each are scored a bit differently.

Name: Ecliptic Travelers
Description:
Let’s make a journey to the world where eclipses often occur! Together we will propose a journey route to make this voyage a wonderful experience. Who will be the Greatest Contributor to the journey route?

Ecliptic Travelers is a competitive game for 2-5 players. The player plays a hand in his turn and proposes a journey route. The player who has used all the cards from his hand is praised for being a Great Contributor to the journey. The player who becomesã€€twice a Great Contributor to the journey, is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Virtue
Description:
Virtue is a co-operative game for 2-4 players that pits your team against the spiritual forces of good and evil. You will strive to live a good life and balance the pursuits that give it meaning. You will quest for internal tranquillity and life-long peace. You will struggle with existential conflict as your angels and demons battle to shape your soul and define your character. You and your fellow man are in this together. Don't let them down.

Each round represents a decade of the players' lives and consists of three phases: Actions, Existential Conflict, and Spiritual Warfare. In the action phase, players move their focus on various vices and virtues, cleanse their soul of the demons that plague them, enhance life pursuits that will unlock new abilities, and increase their tranquility, which will aid them in removing demons. The action phase prepares the team for what is about to come.

After the action phase, each player draws from a deck that will (among other things) swarm their souls with angels and demons. Then, they check for existential conflict, i.e., an abundance of uncontested demons with no angels to stand in opposition. For each existential crisis that occurs, the player has new challenges to overcome.

Finally, the spiritual warfare phase ensues in which the forces of good and evil battle, and the dominating force is left standing for the next decade of their lives.

—description from the designer

Name: Piggy Pearls
Description:
Splat! Oh no! Granny Smyth's pearl necklace has snapped – and now all the precious pearls are lying in the mud where the pigs wallow. The pigs immediately charge out to get as many pearls as possible. Help them by finding the right pearls as quickly as you can and placing them in your trough. Be the first to show off the perfect string of pearls!

Aim of the game:
The aim is to be the first to find the pearls that match the face-up pearl cards and get the most points. This means turning over the mud tiles as fast as you can.

The game consists of several rounds. One round is always played as follows:


     Rooting (all pigs at the same time!)
     Claiming the pearls
     Checking the claim and awarding the pearl card
     Preparing for the next round


The end of the game:
The game ends when there are not enough pearl cards left to make the row back up to three. Each player now counts up the points for all the pearl cards they have collected. The player with the most points is the winner. If more than one player scores the highest total, they are joint winners.

Name: Stalemate!
Description:
Inspired by Palm Island, Stalemate is a hand held, solo game where you take the role of the British moving through the trenches in WW1 trying to get victory over the Germans. As the game progress, you will have to fight several skirmishes in order to gain ground and build your army. Will you have a big enough army to defeat the Germans in the battle?

Stalemate is played in eight rounds. Each turn you will choose one of two cards. You will then choose whether to store or rotate a card. When you build your army and gain supplies, you will increase your chances in fighting the next skirmish and ultimately winning the battle.

There are four additional cards that you can add difficulty to the game. Also, there are four variants you play without any additional cards.

Name: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
Description:
¡LARGA VIDA AL REY!

Godzilla, Mothra, Rodan y King Ghidorah se han reunido bajo el cielo tormentoso de Boston para librar su última batalla. Con la ayuda del ORCA, los científicos de la organización Monarch pueden controlar a estas poderosas criaturas... pero, ¡cuidado! ¡Los titanes son imprevisibles!

Basado en la aclamada película de Warner Bros y Legendary Pictures, GODZILLA: REY DE LOS MONSTRUOS es un juego trepidante y repleto de giros inesperados.

Cada jugador maneja a un científico de Monarch con habilidades únicas. En la FASE CIENTÍFICA cada jugador hace avanzar una de las cuatro tecnologías posibles (ORCA, Destructor de oxígeno, Comunicaciones y Arqueología). En la FASE MONSTRUOSA cada jugador desata el poder de uno de los cuatro titanes. Las batallas son rápidas y violentas, con tiradas de dados, contraataques y empujones.

Los jugadores tienen dos objetivos secretos. En su OBJETIVO CIENTÍFICO aparecen dos tecnologías para ser desarrolladas. En su OBJETIVO MONSTRUOSO aparecen dos titanes que deben ser destruidos. El primer científico en cumplir ambos objetivos GANA EL JUEGO y es nombrado líder de Monarch. Sin embargo, las cosas no van a ser tan fáciles como puede parecer en un principio: los jugadores pueden adquirir cartas de evento con diversos efectos, capaces de dar la vuelta a la partida en un momento.

¿Estás preparado para unirte a la lucha y enfrentarte al REY DE LOS MONSTRUOS?


LONG LIVE THE KING!

Godzilla, Mothra, Rodan and King Ghidorah have gathered under the stormy sky of Boston to fight their last battle. With the help of the ORCA, the scientists from Monarch can control these powerful creatures ... but, beware! Titans are unpredictable!

Based on Warner Bros and Legendary Pictures monster hit, GODZILLA: KING OF THE MONSTERS is a fast-paced game packed with unexpected twists.

Each player controls a Monarch scientist with unique abilities. In the SCIENTIFIC PHASE each player advances one of the four possible technologies (ORCA, Oxygen Destroyer, Communications and Archeology). In the MONSTER PHASE each player unleashes the power of one of the four titans. The battles are violent and fast, with dice rolls, counterattacks, and shoves.

Players have two secret objectives. The SCIENTIFIC OBJECTIVE, shows two technologies to be developed. The MONSTER OBJECTIVE shows two Titans to be destroyed. The first scientist to accomplish both objectives WINS THE GAME and is named the leader of the Monarch. However, things are not going to be as easy as they may seem: players can acquire event cards with various effects, capable of turning the game around in no time.

Are you ready to join the fight and face the KING OF MONSTERS?

-description from designer

Name: MacGowan & Lombardy's The Great War
Description:
MacGowan & Lombardy's The Great War by award-winning game designer Dana Lombardy is a simple, fast-playing stand-alone (non-collectible) 2-player card wargame built around important weapon systems, commanders, and other historical aspects of this unprecedented industrial-scale war. Two 54-card decks feature colorized historical images and illustrations by game industry Hall of Fame graphic artist Rodger B. MacGowan. Icons, insignias, and game text on each card eliminate the need for complex rules. (Note to collectors: Nearly all of Rodger's exceptional WW1 illustrations appear on the cards.)

—description from the publisher

Name: Das große Bundesliga-Quiz
Description:
Das große Bundesliga-Quiz, The big Bundesliga quiz contains 900 questions on current and historical events in the 50-year Bundesliga history. 
It is a knowledge quiz for young and old. 
With different levels of difficulty, children can play against adults or against each other. 
Four different game variants from training to tournaments, test your knowledge of the Bundesliga and stay exciting until the end. 
The talking pen holds the points and cheers the players on.
Questions about the ewigen Tabelle, about current events (2013), club colors, club anthems, players etc...

Name: NAT 1
Description:
NAT 1 is RPG themed party game. Players react to wacky and unique situations of RPG's with their equally wacky and unique response. A judge plays a situation cards and the players submit their best response. The judge then chooses a winner of the round based on the accuracy or hilarity of the card. The judge then changes to the person on your left, and so on until one player wins five situations and is deemed the winner of the game. Enjoy this hysterical game that gives people an insight into the wonderful world of roleplaying and its endless possibilities.

-description from designer

Name: Five Klicks Upgrade Pack
Description:
Time to power up your game. The Upgrade Pack adds the following content to Five Klicks

     Talents - 20 special skills for the battle field and off of it, to help make your characters cooler and more distinctive.
     Enhanced encounter table, updating the rulebook table to be tougher, more challenging and more interesting.
     Story Points to tweak the outcomes of your games.
     Gun upgrades. Tweak your firearms to create the perfect gun for your hero.
     Chapter 1.1. Continue playing after you win, with increased difficulty.


—description from the publisher

Name: Oxi Day
Description:
In the wee hours of the morning of October 28th, 1940 Benito Mussolini, representing the Fascist party that had overthrown the Italian government, offered an ultimatum to Greece to submit to their authority. This demand contained a long list of capitulations including allowing Axis forces to enter and occupy fundamentally any "strategic location" they felt was appropriate. 
Summoning his inner Leonidas, Prime Minister Ioannis Metaxas' apocryphal response to the litany of demands was simply "Οχι" ... No.

The scenario is designed to represent the battle as a skirmish at 1 figure:1,000 men, for QILS rules using 25mm or 28mm figures on 1” bases. Fifteen millimeter figures on 3/4” bases can be used by using centimeters instead of inches.  
And of course, instead of skirmish figures you could use 6mm or 3mm figures on 1" bases.  
The scenario makes a small board that is nice for games in more restricted environs, while still capturing the top level command challenge. 
The troops are specified for our free QILS skirmish rules. Guidelines are provided to convert to other systems.

—description from the publisher

Name: Signal: Unplugged
Description:
'Rinko', the best engineer in Folder Building.

'Rinko' assembles puzzle parts to create the ultimate robot.

To complete the robot, you need to find the parts in the folder room.

Let's take part in the algorithmic parade of the computer city.


    How do computers work? 'Signal' 


means conveying or commanding information about specific content through signs, symbols, sounds, gestures, etc.

Collect puzzle pieces by executing commands sequentially.
Or, if necessary, repeat and program to fix the problem.

<Purpose of the game>
1. You have to quickly match the puzzle by finding the puzzle piece that fits in the blank space of the puzzle.

<Game ready>
1. Spread the board plate and do not let the parts pieces face down.

<Game play>
1. You have to find the puzzle pieces that match your own color. To get the pieces of the puzzle like this, you need to use a special icon drawn on the dice.
2. Use the (Go straight), (Rotate left), (Rotate right), and (Repeat) icons to move your robot to find the piece.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when one of the players completes the puzzle.

Name: Yowon12: Unplugged
Description:
Clever mentor'Jolly'  With the help of Mir, Jolie deploys agents and checks computer functions to stabilize the computer city. 
Let's explore computer terms and functions with Jolie.


    What terms do you need to know to get acquainted with computers?


When using computers we come across a lot of terms.
There are also many interesting stories from the origins of computer terms.
Let's get acquainted with the computer terminology while playing a fun unplugged game with 12 agents.


    cookie-It is derived from the fairy tale of Hansel and Gretel, and helps to keep the information of the sites you visited and came out of, as if you had sprinkled a piece of cookie and followed it to the house.



    bug-An error occurred in the computer, and when we analyzed the cause, it was caused by a moth that entered the computer.


<Purpose of the game>
1. You have to store a lot of your cards in the storage.

<Game ready>
1. Prepare 2 board plates (memory plates).
2. On the back of each card draw 12 cards of the same color.
3. Shuffle the cards you have, place them on the front deck, and draw 3 to check.

<Game play>
1. The first player chooses 1 out of 3 cards and boards it on 1 slot (memory).
2. The next player is also placed on the board (memory) he wishes to place on his turn.
3. While placing an agent card, try executing the abilities written on the card.
4. If the board (memory) is full like this, the cards in the blue box are backed up, and the cards in the yellow box are discarded.

<Game ends>
1. The game is over when all 12 agents have completed their role. Those with a lot of backed up data win. 
(If the number of data is the same, the person who dumps less in the trash wins.)

Name: Mortem et Gloriam: Battles of the Great Commanders 1 – Age of Attila
Description:
Mortem et Gloriam: Battles of the Great Commanders 1 – Age of Attila covers campaigns around the Fall of the Roman Empire. This companion book covers the context, notable leaders, armies, history, campaigns and major battles of a specific period of ancient history, combining the latest research into a guide to the period. The books contain much detail that is useful to any Ancients gamer and, in addition, ready-made refights and campaign ideas for use with Mortem et Gloriam ruleset.

This book is a supplement for the Mortem et Gloriam Compendium Edition; it is not a standalone set of rules.

Name: Le Jeu du Centre Manche
Description:
Le Jeu du Centre Manche is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers. 
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of the Center Manche region, country of Saint-Lô, Coutances, Torigni...

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Tholian Master Starship Book
Description:
Cadets, if a collar is added to the Neo-Tholian dreadnought, how do we identify the ship? No one knows except Cadet Granger? Very well, Cadet Granger.
If a Neo-Tholian dreadnought has a collar, then it is a Neo-Tholian heavy dreadnought.
Quite correct, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, study up on the collars by reading your copy of the Tholian Master Starship Book. Dismissed!

The ninth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series is now available. 
It includes every Tholian and Neo-Tholian ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships and general units that are specific to the Tholian Holdfast. There is also information about the Tholians during the Early Years period when they first arrived in the Milky Way Galaxy.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Federation Master Starship Book
Description:
Dad, what kind of starship is that?
Let’s get you the Federation Master Starship Book so you can look it up!

The first volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Federation ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Federation. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Hydran Master Starship Book
Description:
Sir! What is that? It looks like a bug-eyed monster and I don’t recognize its ship!
Cadet, after this simulation is over, you will return to your quarters and review the Hydran Master Starship Book. You will be tested on the ships tomorrow. And never, ever refer to the Hydrans as BEMs. Dismissed!

The second volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Hydran ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Hydran Kingdom. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Klingon Master Starship Book
Description:
Cadet, there’s a Klingon ship approaching. What is it?
Sir, it is a D7 battlecruiser. Arming phasers on your command!
Cadet, that is the Overlord, a D7N diplomatic cruiser. Diplomats take a dim view of having phasers pointed at them or their ships. After this simulation is over, you will return to your quarters and review the Klingon Master Starship Book. Dismissed!

The third volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series is now available. It includes every Klingon ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Klingon Empire. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rus̄tiKo!!!
Description:
RusÌ„tiKo!!! is a game inspired by RisiKo!, with an Abruzzo theme.

Your farm vehicles must conquer your opponent's territories (exactly like RisiKo!'s tanks).

Cards portray typical items from Abruzzo, such as arrosticini (sheep-meat skewers), trabocchi (fishing machines), olive trees, the warrior of Capestrano, and so on.

There are 43 territories.

—user summary

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Romulan Master Starship Book
Description:
Cadet, identify that Romulan ship which just uncloaked off our front shield!
Sir, that is a King Condor battleship. My copy of the Romulan Master Starship Book notes that it is conjectural. Should we try to escape to warn the Federation that it is not conjectural?
Well done, Cadet! Were this not a simulation, we would indeed do exactly that. However, since this is a simulation, let’s see if we can still carry out our mission.

The fourth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Romulan ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Romulan Star Empire. Romulans are especially challenging because of the history of the various great houses insisting on a particular design, the various stages of early versions of what would become the cloaking device, and the addition to their fleet of converted Klingon ships.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Lyran Master Starship Book
Description:
Cadets, how did the Lyrans produce their Lion dreadnought? Anyone beside Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger.
Sir, it involved cutting a Tiger-class heavy cruiser in half and installing a new center section.
As usual, Cadet Granger is correct. The rest of you, study your Lyran Master Starship Book. It isn’t a paperweight, you know.

The fifth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Lyran ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Lyran Star Empire. Lyrans are interesting because some ships were assigned to particular duchies. (This book does not focus on ships from the Lyran Democratic Republic; those will be in their own book.)

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Go and Stop
Description:
Agents scouting the computer city want to do a final system check before returning.

It detects the treasure signal, finds the error, and decides to come to the control room for debugging so that the system can operate normally.


    How do you get your computer to work?


When we have the information we are curious about or want, the computer shows the results as we command them.
Computers do not do things based on their own judgment, but do things in order by human commands.
If the value of the path is wrong, it can be modified again.


     The programmer gives the computer the correct command to do the job.



     The computer (programmer) listens to the programmer's instructions and does the same.



     Debugging corrects misuse or reprogramming.


<Purpose of the game>
1. Build teamwork and get 3 treasures quickly, starting with the enemy team.

<Game ready>
1. Spread the board and place the treasure tiles in your pocket and mix well.
2. Team up in pairs and pick up a pen.

    Two-player play: One player plays the program and the other plays the programmer role.
    4 player: 2vs2 team member structure, one player in the team takes on the role of the program and the other is the programmer.


<Game play>
1. The player in charge of the program holds the pen in the starting position (pear) and closes his eyes.
The programmer takes the treasure out of his pocket and checks his location.
2. The programmer gives instructions, and the program follows the instructions and draws a path with a pen. You can command up to 3 times, and you can only shout direction and Go, Stop.
3. Put a clockwise direction in front of Go to tell the computer the direction.
ex) Direction (â˜… Hour) + Go + Stop
4. If the computer is hit by an island, whale, or shark while running, the programmer stops the command and clears the path.

     Correcting errors due to errors is called debugging.


5. When you find a clue, you switch roles.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when one team gets 3 clues, and the team that gets 3 first wins.

Name: Pop Corn: Unplugged
Description:
Agent 'Dogberg', preparing for a computer city reconnaissance, goes to the computer city, prepares popcorn to eat, and then contacts the routine. 'Dogbug' can't understand me. Let's help 'Dogbug' to help you understand the language.


    How do computers represent information?


How can a computer know a person's language?
Computers use computer language to express data such as numbers and letters, or images such as photos and pictures.
1 on power on, 0 on power off, 1 for high dial tone, 0 for low dial tone. Like this, the computer can solve everything with two numbers, 0 and 1.

<Purpose of the game>
1. The sum of the numbers written on the popcorn must be greater than the other players.

<Game ready>
1. Save the information (popcorn) to your computer (pocket).
(Put the popcorn tiles in the pocket and shake to mix well.)
2. The cards are flipped over with the 0s visible and placed in ascending order from right to left.

<Game play>
1. The first player must take one less than the number of players from their pockets to fry them in the center of the table.
ex) If 4 players play, only 3 popcorn will be fried.
2. If it's fried in popcorn, flip the card over and make the number written on the popcorn first. Once you have made the number you see, you can shout "POP", then take the popcorn and place it in front of the card and wait a while.
3. If all the popcorn (information) is gone, make sure the popcorn you brought together and the binary card match. If it is right at this time, stack it next to it. If it is wrong, return the tile you brought, and return it from the number of tiles you have acquired.
4. When a new round begins, the player to the left in a clockwise direction starts the round with popcorn.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when there are no more popcorns to bounce, and a lot of people win by adding the number written to the total popcorn earned.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: LDR Master Starship Book
Description:
Sir! Lyran ship approaching!
Load photon torpedoes. Fire all phasers!
End simulation. Congratulations, cadets. You just started a war with the Lyran Democratic Republic, a neutral power. Go study your LDR Master Starship Book. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The sixth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every  Lyran Democratic Republic ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships and general units that are specific to the Lyran Democratic Republic. The LDR has very specific information because it was such a small empire. There are no Y-ships as the LDR didn’t exist in that timeframe. (This book does not focus on ships from the Lyran Star Empire; those are in their own book.)

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Kzinti Master Starship Book
Description:
Cadets, how do we know the Kzintis considered building a battleship? Anyone other than Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger?
They attempted and failed to build the large warp engines it would require. Simulations showed that the proximity of the engines would require extra shielding and the engines would be more vulnerable to damage.
You are correct, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, go study your Kzinti Master Starship Book. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The seventh volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Kzinti ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and general units that are specific to the Kzinti Hegemony.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Gorn Master Starship Book
Description:
Cadets, why do the Gorns have so many of what we consider to be “hybrid ships” such as the destroyer-battlecruiser?  Anyone other than Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger?
The Gorn legislature is notoriously stingy so the Gorn Admiralty plans ahead and finds ways to make larger ships from smaller ones.
You are correct as always, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, go study your Gorn Master Starship Books. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The eighth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Gorn ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and general units that are specific to the Gorn Confederation.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Zip
Description:
'Jeep' checking the luggage of agents preparing to leave for computer city

Take a look at the size and weight of your luggage on the space board.
You are trying to pack it in the shape of a gear, but the luggage is too big to be packed.
Find the same pattern and reduce or compress it to pack a lot of capacity.


    How to free up computer storage space?


If the amount of information is large compared to the limited storage space of the computer, the computer slows down and takes a long time to deliver.
In an efficient way, patterns can be simplified by coding when the same letter, number, etc. are repetitive.
Compression increases the storage space and speeds up the Internet.


    Compression means removing empty spaces between data stored on your computer and coding it to simplify repetitive data.
    Decompression means returning data to its original state.


<Purpose of the game>
1. The pile of tiles piled up by compression should be many and high.

<Game ready>
1. Arrange all the pattern tiles (data) in line with the board (computer capacity).
2. Each of them draws one mission tile (key keyword), checks it, and puts it face down so that it's hidden from opponents.

<Game play>
1. Select the pattern tile (data) you want to compress.
Ex: If there is more than one condition, information can be compressed. Shape, number, color, etc. It cannot be compressed diagonally.
2. A tile can only be moved once in a straight line in a horizontal or vertical direction if the conditions are met.
3. When compressing, you can compress by placing a pile on the tile, and you can compress by placing a tile on the pile.

<Game ends>
1. The game will end when compression is no longer possible.
The player with the most files on the mission card wins.

Name: Le Jeu du Cotentin
Description:
Le Jeu du Cotentin is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers. 
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Cotentin.

Name: Enigma: Beyond Code – Additional Characters Promo
Description:
The Soul Devourer, Analyst, and Inspector are additional Characters you may include when playing Enigma: Beyond Code.

• The Inspector has been sent by the UK government to secretly investigate how the Agency works. His intention is to demonstrate that the Enigma Machine has no response to a person with a grain of Chaos. A lack of response will prove that the Agency is a gang of charlatans.

• The Analyst was born with a congenital disease depriving her of the ability to walk, but it allowed her to develop extraordinary analytical skills. She loves to solve puzzles of any kind and is ready to aid any specialist invited by the Agency, no matter what the cost is to her or the world.

• The Soul Devourer is an ethereal creature pretending to be a human. He strives to consume the mind of Dark Messiah or Decrypter to activate the Enigma code and return back to his homeworld.

Enigma: Beyond Code - Additional Characters is a promo mini-expansion packed in a zip-bag separate from the base game. It is not normally available in retail.

•••FULL OFFICIAL PNP AVAILABLE IN THE FILES SECTION•••

Name: Blocky Mountains: Schneller Aufstieg / Zeittraining Promo
Description:
Promo-Card for Blocky Mountains, handed out by Noris Spiele at Spiel in Essen 2018.

One side has the track "Zeittraining" (German, "time training") with an exclusive route.

The other side contains the small expansion "Schneller Aufstieg" (German "fast ascent")

Name: Spectre & Vox
Description:
Set in the world of Spectre and Vox in 1893, this exciting 3D table-top adventure game combines lights, sound and interactive storytelling for you to solve your own immersive mystery.

Open up your wooden chest to uncover a perfect replica of a haunted house from deep within the Spectre & Vox archives. Once assembled, download the app and input your password to activate the case file and lose yourself in your own escape room adventure.

As the story unfolds through audio files, touchpoints and immersive soundscapes, explore the rooms and use the props.

Apply your best detective and puzzle-solving skills to plot your route through this epic thriller and finally solve the mystery.

—description from the publisher

Name: Adder: Realtime Chase System
Description:
The Vurdes Aerial Combat Institute has emerged as the premier pilot training facility in the galaxy. In order to gain admission, you've passed written tests and aced your interviews, but one final hurdle lies in your path: Adder. Can you best your rivals in this game designed to test your wits and reflexes?

In this real-time game, 2-4 players chase each other by quickly placing cards on the table in order to move their ship and land it on the opponent's one.

Real time games exist in an unique realm with board games. This one will remind you a bit of Snake, except there are no apples to eat in order to grow longer. What you are trying to do is cover the front or the back of the opponents’ snake, moving your back-most card to the front time and again until you win or you lose. The target is determined by a coin flip, and if you land on the coin or collide into the wrong part of a snake, you lose. This is sure to be a chaotic sort of fun that comes with very few cards and only a single coin as a component (well, apart from the table…)


This is a reimplementation of 2018 9-card game Adder: Realtime Chase System, with more cards (18) that gets the game to 4 players and some new rules.

Released in the February 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.

Name: Demockrasy
Description:
Demockrasy is a two to eight player game in which you play the role of a powerbroker behind the scenes of American politics, putting together Politicians with Supporters whose votes they wield. Players compete to gain Power over the course of the game by voting on legislation their supporters approve or oppose; at the end of the game, the player with the most Power is the winner.

Demockrasy is played over four rounds. Each round has a Drafting phase, when you choose Politicians and Supporters, and a Legislation phase, when you sponsor and vote on Legislation.

During the Drafting phase, players pass several hands of cards around the table, each hand containing Politicians and Supporters. Players pick one of the cards from their hand, play it face-up in front of them, and pass the hand to the next player (passing left or right, depending on which round it is). There are three types of cards: Politicians, which may carry one to five supporters; Supporters, which give their associated politician one, two, or three votes; and Wild cards, which give the player a one-time opportunity to affect a legislative outcome or attack an opposing politician.  Once all players have played five cards, the Legislation phase begins.

During the Legislation phase, each player must sponsor one Bill from their hand of Legislation cards (each player receives four Legislation cards at the beginning of the game).  The player with the top-ranked politician sponsors the first Bill. Once the Bill has been revealed, all players must cast a vote to OPPOSE or APPROVE the bill on behalf of all of their supporters and politicians.  Each player votes the total number of votes provided by their supporters. A simple majority wins; in a tie, the Bill fails.

Supporters may (a) APPROVE a Bill, (b) OPPOSE a Bill, or (c) neither. If a Politician betrays a Supporter--for example, by voting to APPROVE a Bill that's opposed by his or her supporters--then that Supporter will abandon its Politician and break one of that Politician's hearts.  Each politician has 1 to 5 hearts; when the last heart breaks, the Politician retires and the associated supporters are discarded. Players also receive a broken heart--which they can assign to a politician of their choice--when they are on the losing side of a vote.

There are three ways to gain power: (1) if you sponsor a bill that passes, you get 1 Power; (2) if you APPROVE a bill that passes, you get 1 Power; (3) you get 1 Power for each Legislation result that aligns to your Supporters' interests.

After each round, clean up the spent Legislation cards and deal new Demockrasy cards (Politicians, Supporters, and Wild cards) to build up your political staff again! After four rounds, count up the power gained by each player; the most powerful player is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Nostalgia
Description:
From time to time, we all seek refuge in fond memories from our past; reminiscing about warm, cozy places where we once felt safe, blissful moments when everything seemed possible, significant others that made us feel important, made us feel loved... All these nostalgic reflections trigger a bittersweet, fuzzy emotion that gives a different perspective to our never-ending pursuit of happiness..!

The Pursuit of Happiness: Nostalgia expansion introduces the concept of reminiscences; fond childhood memories, unfulfilled desires, dreams and aspirations of the past that players long to revive and pursue... The Nostalgia deck features double-sided cards that, once their requirements are met, unlock unique card types and game-play options to the players. Dealt from the very beginning of the game, these cards will drive players' game choices as they genuinely promote planning ahead. Is it ever really too late to chase your deepest dreams and desires? The expansion also enriches existing card types (Projects, Items, Activities, Jobs, Partners, Life Goals and Child Traits) in order to guarantee a true “blast from the past” experience!

-description from designer

Name: Fantastic Battles
Description:
Fantastic Battles is a fast-play, mass-battle, table-top wargaming system for any fantasy setting. The rules emphasise the tactical concerns of command friction and the fog of war through randomised initiative, tabletop mishap rolls and the impetuous decisions of unsupervised unit commanders.

An all-in-one volume, this book contains the rules for stand-alone pitched battles as well as campaigns.

Twenty-four example army lists are provided; however, army building is designed to be flexible. A toolkit of base profiles and unit traits allow players to build customised armies to suit their own vision of their fantasy faction.

Scale agnostic, with multi-based figures and no individual figure removal, the game can be played using any fantasy figures, or historical armies from the ancient to the early modern period.

—description from the designer

Name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Color of Madness
Description: The Color of Madness adds a new game mode, which offers a different experience, outside of the campaign mode. The sort of expansion that you can take out with friends for a challenging and fun game that will be played in about 90 minutes.  You still need the core box in order to be able to play The Color of Madness.

Name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Weald
Description: The Weald expansion brings two heroes and completes the roster that can be found in the videogame, and of course the board game adaptation.

Name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Warrens
Description:
The Warrens are a unique location, as here you will find something that no other location has. As you explore around the aqueducts, you will see that some of the areas have unique abilities that others don’t. If you stay long enough in these areas, then it is certain that you will get a disease.. A visit to the Sanitarium will be mandatory after you leave the dungeon.

Two new Heroes will arrive at the Hamlet with this new expansion, the Leper and the Antiquarian.

The Swinefolk are the unique enemies you will encounter only in the Warrens location. They are all beasts or human beasts, and their deformities give them high resistances, especially to blight. This expansion gives you 26 new monsters (7 unique monster sculpts and 3 Bosses). For a total of 28 miniatures including the Heroes (not including potential Stretch Goals).

Name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Cove
Description: Prepare yourselves to explore the water-filled nightmares of the Cove. The mysteries of the deep seek to be explored - and revealed. The location where the Ancestor performed his pacts with the water beings - the ancient fishermen, will bring you nightmares.

Name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Crimson Court
Description:
This box adds a new location to the Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game, the Courtyard. The once green and lush gardens of the estate have fallen to decay. Now all you can see is the faintglow of the bloodlight, and a once lavish green place now infested with bloody insect-borne threats... and their unsuspecting victims.

The Crimson Court expansion introduces several new monsters in the game, the insect-like infestation that plagues the estate. In specific, you will get 8 new monsters, spanning from level 1 to level 3, and 4 new Bosses.

This expansion also comes with new Quest cards and new Curio cards, further expanding the Darkest Dungeon: the Board Game replayability. If there are two threats that your party of Heroes should be wary of in this location, is the constant stress and the high chances for bleed and blight.

The Crimson Court comes with 6 new room tiles. These are double-sided tiles, adding 12 new rooms in total that you can explore, making the dungeons even more dangerous and deadly. 12 new room cards are also added in your stash

Name: Stories
Description:
Stories is a family-friendly game that is designed for 2-6 players, takes about 30 minutes per game, and ages 8 and older keep things flowing the smoothest. Be the first to assemble your stories into a winning combination while building connection and trust along the way.

To begin, shuffle the cards and randomly deal 5 cards to each player. The first player draws one card from the deck. They give one card to a player of their choice and read the story prompt. That player gives them one card back and reads the story prompt. Two stories are shared on each turn. Get rid of the stories that don't help you while searching for the stories you need. Play proceeds to the next player until someone wins by having a winning combination of cards. A winning combination may only contain one Wild Card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Egalicon
Description:
Your goal in Egalicon is to capture all pieces of one type from your opponent. Each player starts with twelve pieces on a 6x6 game board: four each of diamond, scissors, and paper, with diamond pieces able to capture scissors, scissors able to capture paper, and paper able to capture diamond.

On a turn, move one of your pieces, one of your towers, or only the top piece of one of your towers. You can move this piece or tower onto an adjacent space that:


     is empty,
     that has one of your own pieces or towers, or
     that has an opposing piece or tower that you can capture.


When you move onto your own piece, those pieces form a tower; either player can look at the pieces within a tower prior to moving. Building towers allows for faster movement of multiple pieces on the game board at the risk of having multiple pieces removed at once, although you can split towers bit by bit by moving only the top piece on a turn.

When you capture an opposing piece or tower, you remove all of those captured pieces from the board. Capture all opposing pieces of one type to win.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition de Paris
Description:
How well do you know Paris?
This edition is a way to know. 
The questions are very specific and you have to have a good knowledge of the city.

Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she/he can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

Name: Family Quizz: Football
Description:
Family Quizz Foot is a trivia game about football: history, football techniques, supporters...


     60 cards / 720 questions
     6 difficulty levels
     3 game modes
     36 tokens
     1 die


The winner is the first player to score 30 points

Name: Schneeballschlacht: Einsteiger-Wargame
Description:
Schneeballschlacht: Einsteiger-Wargame Snowball fight - entry-level wargame.

Schneeballschlacht - Snowball Fight is a simple tabletop wargame without a “war” and is therefore ideally suited for young wargamers to get their feet wet.

3-10 minis per player - 25-40mm

Name: History of Quidditch
Description:
Quidditch is played by children on broomsticks in the back apple orchard, by teams of students at wizarding schools, and by professional athletes whose exploits are followed avidly al over the world. Amazing, right?

Well, now anyone (even Muggles!) can play Quidditch at home with History of Quidditch - The Miniatures Game, which is a card and miniatures game played by 2 or more opposing coaches that replicates the speed and danger of Quidditch on a pitch (board/mat) that plays in a little over an hour.

So grab a pint of butterbeer and shake hands with your opponent. Take a seat and meet your team. Get ready to experience Quidditch like never before!

—description from the designer

Name: Fútbol Base
Description:
Fútbol Base is the board game with which you can experience football as a coach and a player at the same time.

Choose the Football 11 or Football 8 board for your games and design the best formation against your opponent. 
Improve your technique and aim on the practise field and enjoy your evolution as a player.

With Football Base live all the passion of football without leaving home.

Rules:

     Place the players with the formation of your choice (4-3-3 / 5-3-2 / 4-4-2, etc.).
     Put the ball in play... 
     The side in possession of the ball is the one closest to the ball. (or whoever the referee says so)
     A player can only have two consecutive touches of the ball. And the maximum number of touches of the ball per area is 4.
     Shooting at goal is allowed only in the shooting area
     When the player in possession prepares to pass or shoot, the defender can only move 1 player to try hinder her/him
     The player formation can only be altered when the game is stopped (ball out of play)
     If a player shoots and knocks down an opponent it is a foul; On a forward, a penalty is given.
     Shooting or passing is only valid if hit with your hand on the player.
     There can be three changes plus the goalkeeper. 
     Games last 40 minutes. Plus extra time or penalty shootout if needed.

Name: Dung: Unplugged
Description:
Agents browse folders to find information.

Searching sequentially from problem 1, sometimes splitting into sections, sometimes using a hash table...
But... I don't see the dunk.


    Computer Science Principles-Explore/Search


Computers store a lot of data. When it is necessary to find the information you want, it searches, but the computer outputs it according to various condition search methods. This requires command and judgment, and uses effective methods to quickly find data while classifying or selecting data. Alternatively, you can use search keys such as words, numbers, names, addresses, barcodes, and QR codes to let the computer find the information you are looking for.

<Purpose of the game>
1. Match the number of cards on your head strap and collect 3 cards.

<Game ready>
1. Each player tie a headband to his forehead.
2. Each player attaches 1 card to the headband. At this time, you should not know the contents of the card. Then take the recording paper.

<Game play>
1. You can ask questions once at a time.
Ex) card (17)
Question: Is it less than 20?
Answer: yes
2. The player who hears this answer writes.
Ex) card (17)
-The number of cards is less than "20". So my card is above the number "20".
3. Ask questions one by one, and when the correct answer comes up, place the card in front of you and insert a new card into your forehead.
4. If the answer is not correct, place the card without checking it and attach a new card to the headband without checking it yourself.

<Game ends>
- If someone collects 3 cards, the game ends and that person wins.

Name: Trek 12: At Home – Semaine 1
Description:
Trek 12: At Home is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in November 2020 (during the confinement in France).

It consists in three game modes: "À l'intérieur: multi" (multi), "À l'intérieur vs JiMINy" (solo) and "Cookie Challenge" (solo or multi).

Name: O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão
Description:
The game is based on telling strange and bizarre stories, based on the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To whom?”, “With what? " it's because?".

In O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão, players set out in search of bizarre stories to tell when they land in the right house, and try to make their listeners laugh, so that they can earn prestigious coins. The possibilities are endless! Put creativity to the test and tell the best story!

The game takes place with the roll of a dice that moves us forward on the board. Through the house where we fall, we exchange our cards for others of the same color, changing the title of our bizarre news.
When we hit the "Está na Hora" house, we started to invent our story based on the title we were building in front of us.
We have time counted by an hourglass and if we get away with it within that time and we manage to convince the other players, we win a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game the player with the most prestigious coins wins.

Name: Van Gogh
Description:
Van Gogh is a game in which we are the inspirations inside the artist's mind, the minigoghs (meeples), beings with different personalities and special skills: happy, dreamy, impatient, melancholic and playful minigoghs.

The meeples rolling mechanism reflects van gogh's untimely, fickle and creative personality, combined minigoghs can be allocated by their positions: lying, on its sides, standing or upside down.

Our goal will be to use the minigoghs in the most efficient way to paint the works, scoring points of prestige.
In the round, players take turns selecting a character card from those on the table receiving a full bonus. After this, every player to receive the simple bonus of the character.

Each space allocation is scored immediately and the winner will be the one who collaborates most efficiently with the paintings at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: War of the Realms
Description:
War of the Realms is an asymmetric, tactical card game for two players that embraces RTS and TBS games from the past with nostalgic pixel art!

In the game, cards can be played by discarding required number of other cards from hand. Units can be sent to attack enemy realm or defend the player's own realm. The player can also build structures, play events or play upgrade cards. The player can also upgrade their realm, if required cards for next level are in play.

The combat is resolved with dice rolls. After dice result and modifiers are added, the result is compared to an enemy’s armor values. Then the corresponding damage is inflicted.

The game ends if a player destroys an opponent's realm. Alternatively, the game can be won if a realm is upgraded to level 3.

—description from the designer

Name: North South East Quest: Beyond Promo Card
Description:
A promotional direction card for North South East Quest.


A direction card to take the game to other worlds! Mars? Tatooine? Middle Earth? The possibilities are endless.

If you really want to pull out all of the stops, you can take your story into SPACE! How you get there? That's the hard part. Use the hot air balloon? The train? A boat? You need to get REALLY creative with this one.

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Düstere Zeiten – Zwei junge Bewahrer
Description:
Promo for Die verschollenen Legenden: Düstere Zeiten

It is a single card expansion. A camp is placed on the board at the start of the game. One hero has to stay in the camp at the end of the day to protect the two keepers. Otherwise all heroes will loose two willpower. The heroes may gather equipment for the keepers so they can protect themselves. Then a hero will gain 2 willpower at the end of the day if he stays in the camp.

It was offered at the Kosmos online shop during the Spiel.digital 2020.

Name: Hunting Me, Hunting You
Description:
Players in Hunting Me, Hunting You secretly dish out damage in order to hunt their target. They must also pay attention to where and when damage was dealt to be able to identify who it is that's hunting them!

After Target Cards are dealt out by the all-knowing 'Curator' role player begins, starting with the appointed 'Leader' (a role which changes every phase).
Play takes place over two phases, which repeat until the round is over - The Night Phase and The Day Phase.

During The Night Phase players take turns as the only player with their eyes open - placing up to two damage cubes on other players' character cards. As each player 'wakes up' they will see where damage has been placed but not necessarily who did what.

The Day Phases sees players doing one of three actions:


     Reloading - collecting more cubes, up to a maximum of two.
     Spying - looking at another player's Target Card.
     Identifying - accusing another player of being their attacker.


When identifying, players announce who they think has them as their target. If they are correct the accused player dies and is out of the round (not the game). If they are wrong it is instead they who die!

Games are played in tournaments, in which players compete to win the most coins - with players getting paid after every round based on what they achieved.

It's a game about trickery, deduction and killing your friends for money. 5-8 players, with a 4 player variant.

—description from the designer

Name: Hanamikoji: Mini Expansion #1
Description:
Your favorite Geishas are back with more talent and graceful performances! With the Hanamikoji action tiles expansions, you may play this award-winning 2-player game with even more tactics! These expansions contain different tiles combination. Mix and match with the previous action tiles for a more unique gaming experience!

Contains: #1 æˆ€æ„› "to be in love"
Discard 1
Secret 2
Transmit 3
Gift 4

Name: Mord bei Tisch: Backstage
Description:
Mord bei Tisch is a crimi dinner game in which 6-8 players can participate to find out who among them is the murderer of the found victim. In addition to that, every player gets a personal task to fulfil during the evening, which can include finding certain information via asking, hiding certain information during the game, convince other players to join them in certain acts or act in a very specific way during the game.

The backstage case is about the murder on the manager of the famous pop diva Miss Loco.

Name: Parable Parade
Description:
In this exciting game, players must collect complete sets of Parable Cards. You can draw as many cards as you like, but be careful. Draw an Oopsie! Card and you will pay the price! Will you be bold and fearless? Or will you be conservative and cautious?

Jesus was a masterful storyteller. Using common objects like sheep and seeds, Jesus told short but powerful parables to help His audience grasp important spiritual truths. This game features 12 of Jesus’ parables.

The objective of the game is to form complete sets of Parable Cards. Each set comprises 4 cards of the same parable and is identified by a colored title bar on the top-left of the cards. The first player to form 2 complete sets of Parable Cards wins.

Name: Into the Outside: Prelude
Description:
You and two of your close friends are lost in nightmarish woods. You don’t remember how you got here… You will have to survive and desperately search for a way out. All whilst trying to avoid the numerous horrors that lurk in this never ending forest.

Into the Outside: Prelude is a Roll & Write mashed with a Choose Your Own Path story. Push your luck scavenging for food and wood to meet your survival needs. All whilst risking encountering the numerous monstrosities that hunt in these dark woods! Manage your camp, craft items, and level up skills to aid you in the Outside.
